Notation

+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Symbol                              | Meaning                                                               |
+=====================================+=======================================================================+
| $c_1, c_2, \cdots, c_z$             | the thresholds for simplification                                     |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $C_0, C_1, \cdots, C_z$             | the groups for simplication                                           |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $f_{\mathcal{\phi}}(.)$             | the function on temporal processing with parameters $\mathcal{\phi}$  |
|                                     |                                                                       |
| $F_{\mathcal{\eta}}(.)$             | the PDF to fit the data with parameter $\mathcal{\eta}$               |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $g_{\mathcal{\theta}}(.)$           | the function on spatial aggregation with parameter $\mathcal{\theta}$ |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $h(.)$                              | the function on variable transformation, no parameter                 |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $i: 1, 2, \cdots, n$                | the generic space index in the data                                   |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $j: 1, 2, \cdots, J$                | the generic time index in the data                                    |
|                                     |                                                                       |
| $j^*$                               | variation of time index in normalising                                |
|                                     |                                                                       |
| $j^\prime$                          | variation of time index in temporal processing                        |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $k$                                 | time scale in temporal processing                                     |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $m: 0, 1, \cdots, 11$               | remainder of $j^* \mod 12$ for index monthly data                     |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $n$                                 | the maximum space index in the data                                   |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $p: 1, 2, \cdots, P$                | the (maximum) variable index in the data                              |
|                                     |                                                                       |
| $p^*: 1, 2, \cdots, P^*$            | the dimension reduced variable index                                  |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $q(.)$                              | the function on dimension reduction                                   |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $u$                                 | the subtracted constant in benchmarking                               |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $\mathcal{D_s}$ and $\mathcal{D}_t$ | the parameter space for space and time                                |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $\alpha$                            | the subtracted quantity in scaling                                    |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $\gamma$                            | the divided quantity in scaling                                       |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $\eta$                              | parameters in PDF distribution fit                                    |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $\theta$                            | additional parameters in spatial aggregation                          |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $\lambda$                           | the PCA factor loadings                                               |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $\sigma$                            | the standard deviation of the data in scaling                         |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $\phi$                              | additional parameters in temporal processing                          |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| $\Phi^{-1}(.)$                      | the quantile (inverse CDF) function                                   |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+

+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Step                    | Notation                                                           | Notes                                                                                                                                                                       |
+=========================+====================================================================+=============================================================================================================================================================================+
| Raw data                | $\mathbf{X}(\mathbf{s};\mathbf{t})$,                               | $\mathbf{s} \in \mathcal{D}_s$, $\mathcal{D}_s \subseteq \mathbb{R}^2$, $\mathbf{s} = (s_1, s_2, \cdots, s_n)^\prime$                                                       |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         | $x_{p}(s_i;t_j)$                                                   | $t \in \mathcal{D}_t$ , $\mathbf{t} = (t_1, t_2, \cdots, t_J)^\prime$                                                                                                       |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | $\mathbf{X}(\mathbf{s}; \mathbf{t}) = (x_1(\mathbf{s}; \mathbf{t}), x_2(\mathbf{s}; \mathbf{t}), \cdots, x_P(\mathbf{s}; \mathbf{t}))^\prime$                               |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | when the pipeline step can be written in univariate case, the data will be referred to as $x(\mathbf{s};\mathbf{t})$                                                        |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Spatial aggregation     | $g_{\mathcal{\theta}}(x(\mathbf{s};\mathbf{t}))$                   | TODO: to be filled                                                                                                                                                          |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| scaling                 | $\frac{x(s_i;t_j) - \alpha}{\gamma}$                               | [Example 1: z-score standardisation:]{.underline}                                                                                                                           |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | $\alpha = \bar{x}(s; t)$ and $\gamma = \sigma(s; t)$ to standardise the data by the its mean and standard deviation across all time and all space units.                    |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | [Example 2: standardise into unit interval:]{.underline}                                                                                                                    |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | $\alpha = \min[x(s_i, t_j)]$ and $\gamma = \max[x(s_i, t_j)] - \min[x(s_i, t_j)]$                                                                                           |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | where $\min[.]$ and $\max[.]$ are the minimum and maximum value across all spatial and temporal units.                                                                      |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Normalising             | $\Phi^{-1}[F_{\eta}(x(\mathbf{s}; \mathbf{t}))]$                   | [Example:]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                      |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | When PDF $F(.)$ is separately fitted for each month:                                                                                                                        |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | $\Phi^{-1}[F_{\eta}^m(x(\mathbf{s};t_{j^*}))]$ where $j^*$ is all the indexes that satisfy $j^* \mod 12 = m$ for each $m = 0, 1,\cdots, 11$                                 |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Variable transformation | $h(x(\mathbf{s};\mathbf{t}))$                                      | TODO: to be filled                                                                                                                                                          |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Temporal processing     | $f_{\mathcal{\phi}}(x(\mathbf{s};\mathbf{t}))$                     | [Example 1]{.underline}:                                                                                                                                                    |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | aggregate across a time scale of $\phi = k$:                                                                                                                                |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | $$x(s_i;t_{j^\prime}) = \sum_{j = j^\prime-k+1}^{j^\prime}x(s_i; t_j) $$                                                                                                    |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | [Example 2]{.underline}:                                                                                                                                                    |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | aggregate with a kernel weight $\phi = w_{ij}$:                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | $$x(s_i; t_{j^\prime}) = \sum_{j = j^\prime-k+1}^{j^\prime}w_{ij}x(s_i;t_j)$$                                                                                               |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Dimension reduction     | $x_{p^*}(\mathbf{s}; \mathbf{t}) = q(x_p(\mathbf{s}; \mathbf{t}))$ | [Example: first principal component:]{.underline}                                                                                                                           |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         | where $p^* = 1, 2, \cdots, P^*$ and $P^* < P$                      | $$x_{p^*}(\mathbf{s}; \mathbf{t}) = \sum_{p = 1}^{P}\lambda_{p}x_p(\mathbf{s};\mathbf{t})$$                                                                                 |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | where $\lambda_p$ is the loading of the PC1, derived from maximising the variance of the data given the constraint $\sum_{p=1}^P\lambda_p^2 = 1$                            |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| benchmarking            | $x(s_i, t_j) - u$                                                  | where $u$ is a constant of interest in the index constructed.                                                                                                               |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | [Example]{.underline}:                                                                                                                                                      |
|                         |                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         |                                                                    | In SPI, $u = -2$ is the threshold for extreme drought.                                                                                                                      |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Simplification          | $$                                                                 | [Example:]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                      |
|                         | \begin{cases}                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         | C_0 & c_1 \leq (s_i; t_j) < c_0 \\                                 | In SPI, four categories are classified: mild drought: $[-0.99, 0]$; moderate drought: $[-1.49, -1]$; severe drought: $[-1.99, -1.5]$, and extreme drought: $[-\infty, -2]$. |
|                         | C_1 & c_2 \leq x(s_i; t_j) < c_1 \\                                |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         | C_2 & c_3 \leq x(s_i; t_j) < c_2 \\                                | Here $C_0, C_1, C_2, C_3$ are the drought categories: mild, moderate, severe, and extreme drought ($z = 3$) and $c_0 =0, c_1 = -1, c_2 = -1.5, c_3 = -2$                    |
|                         | \cdots \\                                                          |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         | C_z & c_z \leq x(s_i; t_j)                                         |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         | \end{cases}                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                         | $$                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                             |
+-------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
